skill.name: writing-docs
skill.description: Expert at writing high-quality documentation for code, APIs, and projects. Auto-invokes when generating docstrings, creating README files, writing API documentation, adding code comments, or producing any technical documentation. Provides language-specific templates and best practices for effective documentation writing.
skill.summary: Generate comprehensive documentation with language-specific templates and best practices for code, APIs, and projects.
skill.author: C0ntr0lledCha0s

security_audit.summary: This skill is completely safe. Static analysis flagged 89 patterns, but all are false positives from markdown documentation examples. The skill contains only documentation templates and guidelines with no executable code, network requests, or command execution. All detected patterns are markdown formatting (code fences, backticks) and example placeholder URLs in documentation templates.

content.user_title: Generate Professional Documentation with Best Practices
content.value_statement: Writing clear documentation is challenging and time-consuming. This skill automatically generates comprehensive documentation using language-specific templates and industry best practices, ensuring your code is well-documented and maintainable.
actual_capabilities: Generate JSDoc comments for JavaScript and TypeScript functions with parameters, return types, and examples
Create Python Google-style docstrings with Args, Returns, Raises, and Examples sections
Write comprehensive README files with installation, usage, API reference, and configuration sections
Produce language-specific documentation for Go, Rust, Java, and other popular programming languages
Generate function, class, and module documentation following established best practices
Create API reference documentation with parameter tables and usage examples
limitations: Does not analyze code to infer behavior automatically. Requires user input or code review to understand function purpose.
Generated documentation requires validation for accuracy. User must verify technical details match actual implementation.
Templates are opinionated and follow specific style guides. May need customization for projects with different standards.
Does not maintain documentation versioning or change tracking. User responsible for keeping docs synchronized with code changes.

output: A simple, lightweight JavaScript wrapper for popular weather APIs with built-in caching and error handling.

best_practices: Always include at least one working code example in function documentation. Examples help developers understand usage faster than descriptions alone.
Document all parameters with their types and whether they are optional. Include default values when applicable to prevent confusion.
Write the first line as a clear, concise summary that can stand alone. Many documentation tools display only the first line in overviews and search results.
anti_patterns: Do not write documentation that simply repeats the function name. Documentation like 'getName() gets the name' provides no value to developers.
Avoid documenting implementation details that may change. Focus on the public interface, behavior, and contract rather than internal mechanics.
Do not leave example code untested or outdated. Broken examples in documentation are worse than no examples and damage developer trust.

faq.question: What documentation formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports JSDoc for JavaScript and TypeScript, Google-style docstrings for Python, standard comment formats for Go and Rust, and Markdown for README files and general documentation. It provides language-specific templates for each format.

faq.question: Can this skill automatically generate documentation by analyzing my code?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides templates and best practices for writing documentation but does not automatically infer function behavior from code analysis. You need to provide information about what the code does, and the skill will format it properly.

faq.question: How do I customize the documentation style for my project?
faq.answer: The skill provides standard templates as starting points. You can request modifications to match your project style guide, such as changing the docstring format, adding custom sections, or adjusting the level of detail in examples.

faq.question: Does this work with documentation generation tools like JSDoc or Sphinx?
faq.answer: Yes, the documentation formats generated by this skill are compatible with popular documentation tools. JSDoc comments work with JSDoc, TypeDoc, and similar tools. Python docstrings work with Sphinx, pdoc, and other Python documentation generators.

faq.question: Can this skill update existing documentation instead of creating new documentation?
faq.answer: Yes, you can ask the skill to review and improve existing documentation. It can add missing sections, improve clarity, add examples, or reformat documentation to follow best practices while preserving your original content.

faq.question: What is the difference between this skill and just asking Claude Code to write documentation?
faq.answer: This skill provides specialized templates, language-specific formatting, and structured best practices for documentation. It ensures consistency, follows industry standards, and includes comprehensive sections like parameters, returns, errors, and examples that might be missed in general requests.
